title: This game is a dumbed down blood bath
body:
Practically EVERY change this season has just screamed "FIGHT DIE FIGHT DIE" to me and I'm sick of it.

-Uncalled for nerfs to {{summoner:12}}{{summoner:7}}
-Uncalled for buffs to {{summoner:14}}
-The death of vision via {{item:3147}}  and the warding jungle item removed from the game
-Making {{item:3095}} (another front loaded damage item) so strong that it decides which champions are viable based on who is strongest with it at 1/2 items

-Uncalled for nerfs to starting MR/AR
-Unnecessary amounts of damage added to runes/masteries
-Scuttle is so valuable that it causes a ton of duals and full on teamfights
-15 minutes forfeit option added for the shorter, out of control games
-Adding damage to virtually everything, even vision masteries like ghost poro, zombie ward
-A huge amount of the buffs to underperformering champions are on their damage, instead of durability/cc/ect. Even for tanks and supports

replies.body: The AP and AD at level 1 was always there in the old system, don't blame that.  The problem is the new system doesn't have armor and mr at level 1.
The problem isn't exactly the AD/AP, but the amount of it. Old runes gave nowhere the amount we have today. It's more way more than a Long Sword/Tome.
Umm yes it did lol
My point was that we shouldn't just delete the AD/AP.  That would suck for a lot of mages trying to waveclear (Lux already has a hard enough time).
Most AD champions got 15AD at level 1 from old runes alone.

^This
The laughable armor compensation amplifies said problem as well.
A world w/ no SR and DB....that'd be nice.

Could we also make a world without lategame carries? No one likes being instagib in late by Ryze/Tristana/Azir/other crit carries.
Im all in for reducing damage in early to mid game IF we'll do something with late game of these champions.
ignite is needed so you can effectively play agressiv in lane

Plus:

- Conqueror
- Tank support items gutted
- Early sustain in bot-lane nerfed
- Heal/shield bonus items nerfed
- New support champion: an assassin

Really a good job, making this game a pointless burst fiesta :D

early game sustain for ADCs needed to be nerfed.  The problem was that they also changed crit at the same time.  So you went from late game crit carries being the best in their role because they scaled the hardest, scaled quickly, and they didnt loose lane because of the amount of sustain they had access to.

Then, with no transition time, it went to crit carries being useless because they didnt scale in time for most games, they couldnt survive vs lane bullies and all of the support items/runes/champs/spells that had allowed them to function were nerfed.

Riot needs to have clear distinctions between lane bullies and scaling champs, but not make it one sided for either role

I was referring to the support item last nerf, ie. the initial cost raised to 400 gold; this means that supports can now only buy 2 potions in the beginning.
So, you (as a support) are **even more** vulnerable to pokes and bursts in the very first minutes.

It's also true that you can protect your ADC a bit less now (you can't take the bullet for them as before). So... It's somehow related to ADCs too, actually :D

Do people not remember {{item:3504}} ?

When the game has become incredibly warped because of an _item_ being incredibly overpowered, it takes them absolute ages to fix it.

We're going to be stuck with Stormrazor for a while.

Stormrazor has changes on the PBE to reduce it's early burst, which is the issue with it at the moment.



Stormrazor
AD lowered from 65 to 60
Attack speed increased from 25% to 35%
Storm's Edge crit lowered from [160% (+1% per .75 critical strike chance)] to [140% (+1% per .5 critical strike chance)

It's less of a 1 item power spike now and the importance of needing some crit alongside it will prevent Nocturne, Zed, Wukong, Kayn etc abusing it.

They really need to just change the item.  Duskblade is already around for that first hit one shot damage and it's already obnoxiously overbearing; why did we need a second one?

If the only way to make ADCs viable is to turn them into one shot wonder assassins, then it seems like they should fix the rest of the game instead of doing that.

Ahri who was decently weak got a cc buff.Duskblade+Stormrazor synergy is getting removed. Almost all the dmg runes got nerfed+ 2 keystones. Heal got buffed. They are thinking about increasing the base MR/mr growth for champions. Duskblade and Stormrazor burst is getting reduced. 

How about you read the patch notes before complaining on the boards?

To be fair, not everyone reads the patch notes. So assuming he didn't know about the upcoming changes, we could probs cut him some slack.

I mean, after all, we have had to put up with bogus damage since preseason 7.

And those people shouldn't be able to voice uneducated opinions on the matter. We live in the age of the internet. It would take LITERALLY 60 seconds to fact check yourself before making posts making claims that are currently being addressed and then complain were going to have to wait months for them to change.

Whether or not someone is "educated"  regarding upcoming changes to league doesn't change the fact that the game CURRENTLY feels like absolute garbage to play, with little strategy involved. Everyone has the right to complain about the shitfest that is League of One-Shots as it stands right now.

Also, Riot has broken many promises regarding changes to league in the past. They have a habit of taking 1 step forward and 2 steps back. Wouldn't surprise me at all if league is still in this terrible state all next season because Riot are so careless with their "compensation buffs" which usually defeat the purpose of nerfs to begin with.

Having said that, the discontent of the playerbase should be heard, otherwise Riot will think they are doing fine when the opposite is true.

And your statement is an opinion treated as fact. It can FEEL like garbage to play to you. That is fine. Don't lump the remaining 99.9999% of the playerbase with you. I personally enjoy the game just fine. Proper macro play still wins games unless one lane gets absurdly far ahead which only happens when players give up and don't care. Unless you are getting dove by the jungler multiple times any death count over 2 is avoidable. Avoidable at the moment of the death is questionable, but leading up to it is definitely avoidable. Yes, when Camille all-ins you when you are at 300 health the death is arguably "unavoidable", but the 5 bad trades you took prior to that could have been handled better. Blaming the game is only shifting blame from yourself so it doesn't sound like you are the reason for your losses and mistakes so you don't "feel bad". You also will never learn from these mistakes if you do such and thus will have a harder time climbing since you are most likely going to give up since you feel like the power isn't in YOUR hands when it entirely is.

Yes, getting tower dived by Akali at level 3 while at 100% health and giving first blood while she doesn't take single tower shot thanks to her true invisibility is something players can avoid. 

If you enjoy the game just fine, then I will just assume you are the Akali tower diving. Of course the Akali doesn't think theres anything wrong with the game :D
Akali cant dive you under tower level 3 at full health. Would take at least 3 passive procs. I dont even play akali that much.
